banners.title: Discover Europe: One Continent, Endless Stories
banners.description: Whether you're sipping espresso in a Roman piazza or wandering through Prague's cobblestone streets, Europe has a way of stealing your heart. With so many countries so close together, it‚Äôs one of the easiest places in the world to tour. From historic cities to scenic coastlines, this guide covers the highlights, travel tips, and how to pick the right tour for your style and budget.

banners.title: Ready to Tour Europe?
banners.description:
Whether you‚Äôre tracing history in ancient ruins or sipping wine in a vineyard at golden hour, Europe has a way of staying with you long after the flight home. 
 Big cities. Small towns. Street markets. Quiet cathedrals. Your Europe tour can be anything‚Äîstructured, spontaneous, luxurious, or lighthearted. 
 üëâ Start exploring Europe now‚Äîyour story is waiting.

carousel-infinite.title: 10 Must-See Cities That Capture Europe‚Äôs Magic
carousel-infinite.paragraph: With dozens of incredible countries and thousands of unique cities, it‚Äôs tough to narrow down where to go. But if you‚Äôre starting to plan your Europe tour, here are ten spots you shouldn‚Äôt skip:

items.title: Paris, France
items.text: Iconic landmarks like the Eiffel Tower, world-class art, and charming caf√©s.

items.title: Rome, Italy
items.text: Ancient ruins, vibrant piazzas, and authentic Italian cuisine.

items.title: Barcelona, Spain
items.text: Gaud√≠‚Äôs architecture, beach vibes, and a lively tapas scene.

items.title: Amsterdam, Netherlands
items.text: Scenic canals, bikes everywhere, and a laid-back atmosphere.

items.title: Santorini, Greece
items.text: Cliffside villages, stunning sunsets, and blue-domed churches.

items.title: London, United Kingdom
items.text: From the historic Tower of London and Buckingham Palace to the world-class museums and vibrant West End theatre scene, London is a hub of culture and history.

items.title: Prague, Czech Republic
items.text: This city feels like a fairy tale brought to life, with its medieval Old Town Square, the stunning Charles Bridge, and the impressive Prague Castle.

items.title: Lisbon, Portugal
items.text: A city of seven hills, Lisbon charms with its colorful tiled buildings, historic trams, delicious custard tarts (past√©is de nata), and breathtaking views over the Tagus River.

carousels.title: Best Value Europe Tour Packages
carousels.intro: Touring Europe doesn't have to be expensive. There are tons of affordable options, especially if you plan smart and travel in the off-season.

items.heading: Eastern Europe Rail Tour
items.text: 7 days through Prague, Budapest, and Krakow starting around $599

items.heading: Greek Island Hopping
items.text: 10 days, including Athens and Santorini, from $849

items.heading: Spain and Portugal Group Tour
items.text: 8 days with hotel stays and a guide, starting at $775

items.heading: Backpacker Route
items.text: Multi-city trips with hostel stays for about $500

carousels.title: Experiences You‚Äôll Never Forget
carousels.intro: You‚Äôll find no shortage of ‚Äúmust-sees‚Äù in Europe. Some are obvious, others are hidden in plain sight.

items.imageAlt: Visit art icons like the Louvre or Uffizi

banner-gradient.title: How to Choose the Right Tour
banner-gradient.sub_title: Picking a tour comes down to how you like to travel. Ask yourself a few simple questions and you‚Äôll get a clearer picture.
banner-gradient.footer_text: Once you know your answers, it‚Äôs easier to filter through the thousands of options out there.

category_data.description: How much can you spend each day, all in?
Want to relax or squeeze in five cities in ten days?
Going solo, with friends, or your partner?
Do you like full itineraries or plenty of free time?

card-img.title: Eat Europe One Plate at a Time
card-img.intro: One of the best parts of any Europe tour? The food. It‚Äôs not just about eating well‚Äîit‚Äôs about connecting with culture.

items.text: Make pasta with a local chef in Florence
Taste cheeses and pastries in a Paris food market
Join a tapas crawl in Barcelona
Learn to grill souvlaki in a Greek village
Sip port wine in a vineyard just outside Porto

activities-gallery.title: Culture, Traditions & Local Flavor
activities-gallery.intro: Every country has its quirks and customs. That‚Äôs part of the charm.

items.heading: Dance and drink at Oktoberfest in Munich
Watch parades and wear a mask at Carnival in Venice
Throw tomatoes at La Tomatina in Spain (yes, really)
Slow down for afternoon tea in England
Say "hello" in the local language‚Äîit‚Äôs a small thing, but it matters

img-with-icon-content.title: Which Europe Tour Style Fits You?
img-with-icon-content.description: Not every tour looks the same. Some are structured with guides and daily plans, while others let you roam on your own. It really depends on how you like to travel.

items.title: Guided Group Tours
items.text:
‚úîÔ∏è Everything pre-planned 
 ‚úîÔ∏è Beginner-friendly, stress-free

items.title: Rail Tours

img-with-icon-content.title: Quick Europe Travel Tips & Tools
img-with-icon-content.description: A little planning goes a long way. These tips will help you get the most out of your tour.

items.text: Book popular attractions early (some sell out weeks ahead)
Download an offline map and translator app
Use public transportation‚Äîit‚Äôs clean, cheap, and reliable
Watch your bag in crowded places, especially tourist hotspots
Pack light and bring comfortable shoes
Don‚Äôt over-plan‚Äîleave space for spontaneity
